501124D444EE4425A4F40DE5F4C6F8EF.description: Use the relationship between particular words to better understand each of the words.

96C4886191034DBC91B1031BB77CDC86.description: Use knowledge of vowel/consonant sounds to identify misspelled words.

18278DC122854E0A85B4EA5C449DE595.description: Demonstrate understanding of figurative language, word relationships, and nuances in word meanings.

746D0A8AFE3542E9951BF1A83C700799.description: Incorporate and apply the understanding of word relationships and nuances in word meanings.

185ABA1C11EB4320B79A496EACD9021C.description: Maintain consistency in style and tone.

877CB82DBECD4A4A964FD03536B4440D.description: Vary sentence patterns for meaning, reader/listener interest, and style.

4A1800CF763B4F77BC026063833FA563.description: Use knowledge of language and its conventions when writing, speaking, reading, or listening.

1BF29E48A26D477FAF08DE197B87D168.description: Incorporate and apply knowledge of language and its conventions when writing, speaking, reading, or listening.

58F9117F32214BC785A10283333B0C0A.description: Use commas to separate coordinate adjectives.

C7F6246FD9314A4996BFE1DEDD472FEC.description: Use punctuation (comma, parenthesis) to set off nonrestrictive/parenthetical elements.

C1C2CC8E100B4FEFB43B032E30A91896.description: Use commas, dashes, ellipses, brackets, and parentheses to set off nonrestrictive/parenthetical elements.

C208BB67964548808070FF0A487FED8D.description: Demonstrate command of the conventions of standard English capitalization, punctuation, and spelling when writing.

BCB89EBDE5E24C05890C9BE1FEADA6E3.description: Explain the function of interjections in general and their functions in particular sentences.

92032387D65A4A2293B13A7E85AC60A1.description: Explain the function of adverbs in general and their functions in particular sentences.

339B29928FB04E8B9FE6521B84C048CE.description: Explain the function of adjectives in general and their functions in particular sentences.

F714E7B6B69A445CB33114A76CC76745.description: Identify and use transitive and intransitive verbs.

7F1FF88C78BF492DBD01755B89442E79.description: Use modal auxiliaries (can, may, must) to convey various conditions.

FAB658BA26EE4792BA59B59B84ADBB35.description: Identify and use linking/state of being verbs.

F2A3AAC183AC4F3B92B9C3C89D58D204.description: Recognize and correct inappropriate shifts in verb tense.

D41427FD4B40460B98258C5B982DE84B.description: Identify, define, and use parts of speech: verbs

E93FA35795474E4FAE899BB9F837ADD7.description: Recognize and correct inappropriate shifts in pronoun number and person.

E06342571D554A5180325022B029E7EF.description: Ensure that pronouns are in the proper case (subjective, objective, possessive).

DFB574E5BB354FE29B4F8DA0CBDECA3B.description: Identify the antecedent of the pronoun.

20931075891C49A7B30399DCA9C4D2B2.description: Recognize and correct vague pronouns (ones with unclear antecedents).

7E3B3CFB9EFC4D629B003CB1C4DFCF0C.description: Identify and use demonstrative and indefinite pronouns.

2059FCB574054756BF34C2E9A89F11D1.description: Identify, define, and use parts of speech: pronouns

8D5487227F4148FD89D2FFE99AEC5FAB.description: Demonstrate an understanding of and use of predicate nominative.

F231F376A7DE4414A7F308E7228FEED0.description: Identify nouns with particular emphasis on concrete, abstract, and collective nouns as a part of speech.

26E48DEA1FC6408F890D72BE1E8B5C1D.description: Identify the use of words in the possessive case, nominative case, and objective case.

4EE56E3623414FF4AF6CF8BBF81C56E8.description: Identify the use of nouns of direct address and appositives.

30016E0AB8894D68BB76D623CC753D64.description: Identify, define, and use parts of speech: nouns.

09433DDEA7E24B3F8A061ABB59493FC1.description: Explain the function of phrases and clauses in general and function in specific sentences.

8D3226527C6746C29D65DC3198ADFB60.description: Choose among simple, compound, complex, and compound-complex sentences to signal differing relationships among ideas.

D962353E761947B4A7F776AF0E4A5C5D.description: Identify, define, and use sentences, phrases, and clauses.

4D446A17B7134AC5987C93A08B433846.description: Demonstrate command of the conventions of standard English grammar and usage when writing or speaking

FF28898EFD0F42D595C899B947E107A2.description: Incorporate and apply the conventions of standard English grammar and usage when writing or speaking.

99D7B42A6DDD400C9A886511EE996B0C.description: Design presentations using multimedia components and visual displays to inform.

8E3D710DF7D94667B7A7D0B676BC8DAD.description: Use digital media to enhance oral presentations.

85DE82DBDC5346D4B1743247E1D0A36B.description: Make strategic and morally appropriate use of digital media and visual displays of data to express information and enhance understanding of presentations.

249BCB193D30466394AD3452F196BFDB.description: Explain opinions by citing evidence and referring to sources.

108E5644AF6B41D1BDCCBFFB25312696.description: Speak from notes or a brief outline to communicate information clearly in an organized and sequential manner.

5E30336211E54DFCA3CA0C38D82D98E4.description: Discuss criteria for effective oral presentations.

D01F757D1559425B97D9BD6AEB5F3AF2.description: Apply appropriate eye contact, posture, and gestures.

D6220E0714E44D759B5EE3113E3E9CD4.description: Enunciate words and use correct pronunciation when speaking while employing appropriate volume, expression, and pace.

06E702EBC06649C5B7DB046133D31178.description: Sequence ideas logically and use pertinent descriptions, facts, and details to accentuate main ideas or themes.

6960C7134E2F416083E3DB96FF2A8DE6.description: Compose and present an oral presentation.

4B0AB3112C9D4BC6BE3B3495B2CA95FD.description: Based on Catholic standards, present information, findings, and supporting evidence such that listeners can follow the line of reasoning and the organization, development, and style that are appropriate to task, purpose, and audience

10AD799B129F489F8FF0013356A35877.description: Distinguish between supported and unsupported arguments.

F65A436B710B49F9B84CBB27C12A1DDE.description: Judge the accuracy and reliability of information given in oral presentations.

58537436D4424E2AAAAF5DAF216C364F.description: Summarize the main points of a discussion, orally and in writing, specifying areas of agreement and disagreement.

B1A8C5B293064253A9E392D07AE3D691.description: Follow a speaker's argument and take notes.

25A46541108C43B891F611AA9D02C04C.description: Evaluate a speaker's point of view and reasoning.

73600BE355F14D51A37691A9E327BF52.description: Using a Christ-like model, evaluate a speaker's point of view, reasoning, and use of evidence and rhetoric.

F3B7D8D7F9394DAD9F3E23DCD368C1FF.description: Differentiate between formal and informal contexts or situations.

EC8A53A34D36410A8A2CA29996B96D97.description: Draw conclusions from key points and discussions and when warranted, qualify or justify one's own views in light of the evidence presented.

F5AF02DBF82D42D4A57F4BF154218CEF.description: Establish and maintain an open mind when listening to others' ideas and opinions and respond respectfully.

F5F6D961DBCD4CD0B5F378B76C5A3528.description: Review the key ideas expressed and demonstrate understanding of multiple perspectives through reflection and paraphrasing.

B5E471CEAC5347729F8511AF0CEB6295.description: Follow rules for collegial discussions, set specific goals and deadlines, and define individual roles as needed.

8493CCCE6EF24586B8C7FF854F25A557.description: Pose questions that elicit elaboration and respond to others' questions and comments with relevant observations and ideas that bring the discussion back on topic as needed.

FED7C1A9D089421D8253549D031569D0.description: Display and maintain facial expressions, body language, eye contact, and other response cues that indicate respect for the speaker.

15D3F94646A449A3BA586FB2F7365B7F.description: Use effective strategies to keep a discussion going: inviting the ideas and opinions of others, citing evidence, posing "what if" questions, relating situations to experiences.

904CB2549B1B43D8BE80EE1F70DCAFBB.description: Practice Christian responses to use in conflict situations.

C801E442F1C14E1C84DCB46E0E3A0F52.description: Come to discussions prepared, having read or studied required materials; explicitly draw on that preparation by referring to evidence on the topic, text, or issue to probe and reflect on ideas under discussion.

C52E083D125B4FDB96A63758A2A91D83.description: Contribute and collaborate in discussions by listening attentively, demonstrating respect for the opinions of others, and responding responsibly and courteously to the remarks of others without dominating the discussion.

D80F02EF8F874DEEA2A9ABE877B0FE7F.description: Prepare for and participate effectively in a range of conversations and collaborations with diverse partners, building on others' ideas and Catholic values while expressing one's own clearly and persuasively.

03CE1A9C3A914FA28ACA0C58254E663C.description: Establish and maintain a formal style.

F2B1093FEBDC4BC698050909041C6411.description: Include formatting, graphics, and multimedia when useful to aiding comprehension.

261EC460DE40477CB8B63C85D4C765C0.description: Use proper editing marks when revising, editing, and proofreading, using an editing checklist.

8478F0B7621B4DF3824FE9142B927AF1.description: Identify questions and strategies for improving drafts in writing conferences with others.

B998129D4AE041AF8F85269CCE14727D.description: Provide a concluding statement or section that follows from the information or explanation.

0B50F2519EC04C14985C450ED9304466.description: Use precise language and domain-specific vocabulary to inform about or explain the topic.

810786F7A9ED4EF7ADD31DD441E18EDE.description: Use appropriate transitions to clarify the relationships among ideas and concepts.

130EB5B35E444EFFA27C5FBFD0724C12.description: Develop the topic with facts, definitions, concrete details, quotations, or other information and examples related to the topic.

AB66995641FD42C5ABEF067DC598EF66.description: Quote or paraphrase the data and conclusions of others while avoiding plagiarism and providing basic bibliographic information for sources.

AA3876391D8140A39806E76A4B501E7A.description: Conduct research by formulating initial questions, narrowing the focus of a topic, identifying prior knowledge, and developing a basic plan for gathering information.

C4496320BBEC4E00808FA89EFBD6C9CB.description: Use technology, including the internet, to produce and publish writing as well as to interact and collaborate with others; demonstrate sufficient command of keyboarding skills to type a minimum of three pages in a single sitting.

02A1E62252CF41E695315513833E7850.description: Conduct short research projects to answer a question, drawing on several sources and refocusing the inquiry when appropriate.

D27EF4C0635C470D8F0EBEC81D5CD221.description: Conduct short as well as more sustained research projects based on focused questions, demonstrating understanding of the subject under investigation from Catholic and secular perspectives.

023FEF333263419D960C21132CD9AA5D.description: Establish and maintain a formal style.

0CCEACC726E84BC086D1520B750C4199.description: Explain the reasons for revisions in conferences with a teacher or peer.

B6EAE0FB5016419EA96AD13BBBF7E58C.description: Provide a concluding section that paraphrases the argument presented.

D97353D46BD7429695B534D53C0B3E57.description: Acknowledge alternate or opposing claims citing credible evidence.

357EDCB37FAC41A5A7EC203253717AE7.description: Use words, phrases, and clauses to create cohesion and clarify relationships among claims, reasons, and evidence.

DE2BED3684EE48B299A085D2E9E9E327.description: Support claims with clear reasoning and relevant evidence, using credible sources and demonstrating an understanding of the topic or text.

782C5C2FD0B942FDBD87513E920DFC6E.description: Introduce claims clearly incorporating a hook, transitions, and thesis statement.

B2E215EE1DEE4943B34E85F1FE0C8B81.description: Create an organizational structure in which ideas are logically grouped to support the writer's purpose.

FC9CDD8E03B34812A20F35070C6F959F.description: Use technology, including the internet, to produce and publish writing and to interact and collaborate with others.

8A79B7C8A585436AA0A025F68522643A.description: Write opinion pieces on topics or texts, based on credible sources.

07C6FC6164394BC695BEBA7496C1B7E7.description: Write arguments to support claims in an analysis of meaningful topics or texts using sufficient evidence and valid reasoning that uphold Catholic teachings, traditions, and heritage.

4AF5C5E241C24AC5913BDFF158A9E124.description: Establish and maintain a formal style.

5551092AB1464391B6B07436A8687A74.description: Include formatting (e.g. headings), graphics (e.g. charts, tables), and multimedia when useful to aiding comprehension.

C14116CC732B4E92AA1DFC049581A49C.description: Explain the reasons for revisions in conferences with a teacher or peer.

7116E60A7CB64BA99501A34F26ABB0DD.description: Use proper editing marks when revising, editing, and proofreading, using an editing checklist.

48A7209F23B54A828740F9EAC2A22D2D.description: Identify questions and strategies for improving drafts in writing conferences with others.

B26E53F84CCB48BB9650BF2D7C026A40.description: Organize ideas, concepts, and information, using strategies such as definition, classification, cause/effect, and comparison/contrast.

61C3050381E549388C81126D49304883.description: Use technology, including the internet, to produce and publish writing and to interact and collaborate with others.

A229EEC32E86489EB1F77464405F71D3.description: Write focused informative/explanatory pieces on topics or texts, based on credible sources.

A8E15EF926DC48CBA3404078E0D9F405.description: Write informative/explanatory texts to examine and convey complex ideas and information from secular and Catholic sources clearly and accurately through effective selection, organization, and analysis of content.

00C7EFC1741E4829A2CA9F7F770ACD36.description: Explain the reasons for revisions in conferences with a teacher or peer.

9BB37C3D93DD4A0FB2351E961F6F5116.description: Use proper editing marks when revising, editing, and proofreading, using an editing checklist.

94AC1F66B7DB43C6A9ABF699988BB934.description: Identify questions and strategies for improving drafts in writing conferences with others.

306EE63B1654471CB8BE8F07CFD4909A.description: Provide a conclusion that follows from the narrated experiences or events.

7D42C8C05B544734A856B44464E5FBC2.description: Use a variety of transition words, precise phrases, and clauses to convey sequence and signal shifts from one time frame or setting to another.

1685C58E3F1D442CAA0F45195BA00DF7.description: Use narrative techniques, such as dialogue, pacing, sensory language, and description to develop experiences, events, and/or characters.

570FA3B38CA744D4B5378602C89C18EB.description: Engage and orient the reader by establishing a context, introducing a narrator and/or characters, and determining audience.

59F8BCE0C0A4408D90090CC969D39493.description: To develop plot by organizing an event sequence that unfolds naturally and logically.

D2F1A9E82D524197BBC6B250F1379872.description: Use technology, including the internet, to produce and publish writing and to interact and collaborate with others.

E4D3CAA247C74A3AB3462433957D889F.description: Write a narrative that includes narrative techniques and the elements of a story.

45F52AFDB304467396006C4ACE60E43B.description: Write narratives to develop experiences or events using effective techniques, well chosen details, and well structured event sequences.

1C97DF3F65A7490585B3A25ED385D739.description: Listen to and read biblical, biographical, autobiographical, nonfictional, informational texts, including history/social studies, science, and technical texts, informational articles, essays, narrative nonfiction, interviews, expository text, etc.

5A154014D7014DAD9004097B3E45294C.description: By the end of the year, read and comprehend proficiently at the high end of the grade text complexity band, with scaffolding as needed at the high end of the range.

CAA028617DFA414DB58A4B92B92B34D4.description: Read and comprehend complex literary and informational texts independently and proficiently.

7E609DEA30AC4AE0BAD338A9A10251C2.description: Critique one author's presentation of events with that of another author (e.g. memoir written by and a biography about the same person).

9EC689049054495B8D6E7BD26DD05D44.description: Describe real life experiences as they relate to a text

DFFA49DCBCE747CC966EAED2397A08A3.description: Compare and contrast one author's presentation of events with that of another author.

E6E5CF1A8D8349A199530770E496C5E6.description: Analyze how two or more texts address similar themes or topics in order to build knowledge of themselves, others, and their Catholic heritage.

0A6FAEDD13934B429968B73D00519C95.description: Integrate information presented in different media or formats (e.g. visually, quantitatively) as well as in words to develop a coherent understanding of a topic or issue.

892A3418E88B4D909A90187DB51BDC79.description: Draw on information from multiple sources to develop a coherent understanding of a topic or issue.

F6F95B794F234ECE9028181CD781F1DD.description: Integrate and evaluate content presented in diverse formats and media, including visually and quantitatively, as well as in words, in accordance with Catholic values (e.g. social justice), teachings, and heritage.

A09B7E5418EB4E15BDEAF795461CF2C6.description: Cite text evidence that proves the author's purpose.

F2FEEAA1A69E4988A42ED2B2CD68553A.description: Explain how the author conveys his/her purpose in the text.

0B5FC1A90509486892E7DA7167067974.description: Determine an author's point of view or purpose in a text and explain how it is conveyed in the text.

A7EC647FEBAE4DF39CA9E07E3C91499F.description: In light of Catholic values, traditions, and heritage, assess how point of view or purpose shapes the content or style of a text.

21DEBAC745D8459CA927449EB20EB75A.description: Analyze how a particular sentence, chapter, scene, or stanza fits into the overall structure of a text and contributes to the development of the ideas.

FC57996DD12D488A8FC28A30A2FA50FF.description: Apply the knowledge of text patterns and how it contributes to the meaning of the text.

8526B5CAB42844109A5C6A6325D48892.description: Understand the structure and how it relates to the overall development of the text.

AA8AA6B114E34AB2BE7BFDAE012274F8.description: Analyze the structure of Catholic/secular texts, including how specific sentences, paragraphs, and larger portions of the text (sections, chapters, scenes, stanzas) relate to each other and the whole.

EB21B4B70BF7488FA52CD7E33D33551A.description: Recognize and analyze the use of figurative language in informational text.

D485CFFFD0C04FE0BBD350B09517020B.description: Analyze the impact of a specific word choice on meaning or tone.

A647127C1BD0453DA5E4B309E8DEC577.description: Apply grade level vocabulary in verbal or written responses.

D0A3AC97E5ED4801A86A18B7237F0BEC.description: Develop word meaning by using background knowledge

46A99262986D4C48B9770B4E8EB77807.description: Use reading strategies and context clues to aid comprehension.

86EFA2115249437EB99AB8DE8459187A.description: Determine the meaning of words and phrases as they are used in a text, including figurative and connotative meanings; analyze the impact of a specific word choice on meaning and tone.

4B678C380513428881AE0891D71FBB47.description: Interpret words and phrases as they are used in text, including determining technical, connotative, and figurative meanings, and analyze how specific word choices shape meaning, tone, and Catholic identity.

3EAA7B6E62DE47F590CB3F3474C3783B.description: Justify how the key details support the main ideas.

37A95F64FA8144038137762A3BAE10D6.description: Summarize the selection separate from personal opinions or judgements.

3B855EF84B2C45439BFA47CF542B48A3.description: Analyze the development of a central idea and its relationship to supporting details

77142136E66B4F24950503207D016756.description: Identify a central idea and analyze how it relates to life experiences and reflects faith values.

EE0C3727490B4A26B3764710036CD398.description: Determine a central idea of a text and how it is conveyed through particular details; provide a summary of the informational text distinct from personal opinions or judgements.

29E3A86889714CAD881276DDC37F97CC.description: Determine and analyze the development of central ideas or themes of secular texts and text that reflect Catholic teachings, values, traditions, and heritage, and summarize the key supporting details and ideas.

B32EAEF3AC494F8D9D29F914A99D17C8.description: Defend and support inferences drawn from the text.

2285E42A8ABC4EC9BB02B6F778CD8F27.description: Write responses to informational text that develop an interpretation around clear ideas that shows careful reading, understanding, and insight, including an understanding of Catholic values, traditions, and heritage

E27D657AC2544B18899568F4E3656CE8.description: Cite textual evidence to support analysis of and inferences drawn from Catholic/secular informational texts.

99148F7A8AF44734B467621C9C55C220.description: Read closely a wide range of text material, from secular, Catholic, and Christian spiritual/religious viewpoints to determine what it says explicitly and to make logical inferences from it; cite specific textual evidence when writing or speaking to support conclusions drawn from the text.

B563EEBE15F04F59950C47D9678B1808.description: Listen to and read Scripture, fables, epics, myths, tall tales, dramas, poetry, short stories, novels, science fiction, fantasy, realistic fiction, historical fiction, mysteries, humor, and narrative nonfiction.

5E893D62D6234D49A634145C57F48A92.description: By the end of the year, read and comprehend literature of appropriate complexity independently and proficiently, scaffolding as needed at the high end of the range.

0CD131C310594139888A5A54F1DFEB44.description: Assess how point of view or purpose shapes the content and style of a text.

BACFE334A8AC46719467E1C11045D898.description: Examine life experiences as they relate to a common theme within a text.

AE89405558264474A2B17C3D8B64D76F.description: Compare and contrast texts in different forms or genres in terms of their approaches to similar themes and topics.

B9C6734A721047B189455BEA58008087.description: Compare and contrast different genres in terms of their approaches to similar themes and topics.

BD254755BF1D4954B04D34754021383A.description: Analyze how two or more texts address similar themes or topics in order to build knowledge of themselves, of others, and of their Catholic heritage.

6E441454D103475582B812AA94DA72A2.description: Compare and contrast what they "see" and "hear" when reading the text to what they perceive when they listen or watch.

C3C66460396048F58287D1A057F2F415.description: Compare and contrast the experience of reading a story, drama, or poem to listening to or viewing an audio, video, or live version of the text.

65B496D649CA480C96A3B4D37548EB2E.description: Differentiate between reading a text, listening to/viewing an audio, video, or live version of the text.

812E63CF90D340ABA0315EDE439C0451.description: Integrate and evaluate content presented in diverse formats and media, including visually and quantitatively, as well as in words, in accordance with Catholic values (i.e social justice), cultural teachings, and ethnic heritage.

FC2F2F1BD4A54F15BA97DAC4F8D2C08F.description: Identify literary devices: irony, propaganda, satire, allegory, mood, and tone.

F51C4D3EA40345C4A994881BD24BE1CD.description: Cite text evidence that proves the author's purpose.

DF70039F0F454F358C1D2A34E2D3361D.description: Develop and justify own point of view at various points within the text.

18AEC45E34CA48539BE641FA4AF16243.description: Explain how an author develops and contrasts the points of view of different characters.

C63D8495B2274B5A96E856DCD051B74C.description: Using textual evidence, explain how an author develops the point of view of the narrator or speaker in a text.

98CE50ECCBEC4377B65E042F3634E002.description: Understand and analyze how an author develops the point of view of the narrator or speaker in a text and conveys the purpose.

C96A40B15E434690B2A7090E1E59DE27.description: In light of Catholic values, cultural traditions, and ethnic heritage, assess how point of view and purpose shapes the content and style of a text.

13C15D56A349483EBE0C599A839A1F34.description: Analyze how a particular sentence, chapter, scene, or stanza fits into the overall structure of a text and contributes to the development of the theme, setting, or plot.

8969A053FC33435EA03E01E87E449FBC.description: Compare and contrast types of fiction and nonfiction.

EB072DA9E3DB4966BC38429091BA539D.description: Compare genres using a variety of reading materials (Scripture, fables, epics, myths, tall tales, dramas, poetry, short stories, novels, science fiction, fantasy, realistic fiction, historical fiction, mysteries, humor, narrative, nonfiction).

07A7206C87D04963BA7F2C1A23B81EE0.description: Draw on a broad base of knowledge about the genres of literature, including the structure and conventions of genres when interpreting the meaning of a literary work.

570D8E90D9E142509B6CF1E68DA62DC1.description: Analyze the structure of texts, including how specific sentences, paragraphs, and larger portions of the text (section, chapter, scene, stanza) relate to each other and the whole.

55A7C93F835548AFBDCB063C3D6243B9.description: Analyze the impact of a specific word choice on meaning and tone.

38093D1F0014482BBB169A6E77594923.description: Explain the difference between literal and figurative meaning.

962E231E19D246448D6C6D1F46154D8C.description: Recognize and analyze the use of figurative language: simile, metaphor. personification, hyperbole, symbolism.

9701C411253240ABBC7B125DDA230637.description: Recognize and analyze the use of literary devices such as alliteration, onomatopoeia, rhyme, rhythm, and repetition.

C4FF70B89D384E97A5665D16DBCE286D.description: Apply grade level vocabulary in verbal and/or written responses.

D26AF73F9A924BB8BA21BCA3C664A56D.description: Use reading strategies, background knowledge, and context clues to aid comprehension.

AA56CF1CF3B2409CA5D9390A554FC5DD.description: Infer meaning of unfamiliar words in the context of a passage by examining known words.

7A9E42B8147F4078BFED1E3445EA1CEA.description: Determine the meaning of words and phrases as they are used in a text, including figurative and connotative meanings; analyze the impact of a specific word choice on meaning and tone.

D234FA97E159474791C5DC887BB86752.description: Interpret words and phrases as they are used in a text, including determining technical, connotative, and figurative meanings, and analyze how specific word choices shape meaning, tone, and Catholic identity.

7D8520799231443485B9C3EA6289B9F6.description: Understand and identify the speaker's point of view.

B7D86B6C64A3498BB7AA98F96BAA6D57.description: Describe how the plot of a particular story or drama unfolds in a series of episodes as well as how the characters respond or change as the plot moves toward resolution.

D2407D2126FC46678912D407F66BD097.description: Identify major and minor themes and analyze how they relate to life experiences and reflect faith values.

F7082D2A140144CDAB65D9FF92C3412F.description: Use moral decision making models to evaluate character's choices.

9D957C41082C4C789ECBB3BCF1CD641D.description: Recognize and recall elements and details of story structure, including main idea, protagonist, antagonist, exposition, rising action, climax, falling action, resolution, foreshadowing, flashback, author's purpose, identification of the narrator, irony, and conflict.

548372A697814B589BEC944766B3DDF1.description: Listen to, read, and recount short stories, novels, dramas, plays, Psalms, and poems.

934A05EF4F284B33A112093FAA4CF467.description: Determine a theme or central idea of a text and how it is conveyed through particular details;provide a summary of the text distinct from personal opinions or judgements.

A87B20FE32B24223A0CBF8254DF89E93.description: Determine and analyze the development of central ideas or themes of secular texts and texts that reflect Catholic teachings, values, traditions, and heritage and summarize the key supporting details and ideas.

BE9EB192CB98459D8E4041A7687828FF.description: Defend and support inferences drawn from the text citing textual evidence.

B13A65C2A2114535BFE19CF5176C0E70.description: Write responses to literature that develop an interpretation around clear ideas that shows careful reading, understanding, and insight, including an understanding of Catholic values, traditions, and heritage.

2BB6A832F0EB4FDE96E9CF5C9F6E6195.description: Cite textual evidence to support analysis of and inferences drawn from Catholic/secular texts.

6722B0AF7EEB4DBCBD1A3A9148A5C3BC.description: Read closely a wide range of text material from secular, Catholic, or Christian spiritual/religious viewpoints to determine what it says explicitly and to make logical inferences from it; cite specific textual evidence when writing or speaking to support conclusions drawn from the text.
